posts.cooked:
I’m happy to announce the first stable release of Molly, the hardened version of Signal for Android!

Take a look at the highlights for this version on the releases page in GitHub, and check out the README for more information.

Molly has unique security features compared to Signal, especially helpful to protect your privacy in case your smartphone is stolen or searched. As a former computer forensic analyst, I have been researching on how to circumvent smartphone forensics, and Molly’s hardlock is the outcome of this work.

To those who might grumble about advocating anti-forensic, just look around and find out the huge list of legitimate and non-criminal reasons to use these techniques — for example, to protect ourselves against the actions of oppressive regimes, to prevent corporate espionage, or simply on grounds of principle and ideology.

I would also want to thank all people who helped me to test it thoroughly

If you would like to report a bug, please open an issue on GitHub.

Cheers!

shellSignal:

Molly can work with other users using Signal/Android app.

Absolutely. Encrypted messages only. Molly does not support SMS/MMS for good reasons.

shellSignal:

Are Signal/Android and Molly still compatible to the point of creating Signal/Android backup and restore messages in Mollly?

Yes, fully compatible. Backups created by Signal v4.52.4 and later can be imported into Molly, and the other way around. The backup folders have distinct names to avoid conflicts, so backups files must be moved manually from one folder to the other.

newuser:

Everything works and you effectively have two primary clients?

Clients on the production environment cannot communicate to clients on the staging environment. The services are fully isolated, as @awaitlink remarked. The servers running on staging are not production-ready, don’t scale, and sometimes, the staging database is reset by the Signal team. For those reasons, staging should not be used except for testing proposes.

newuser:

Would you also be open to pull requests which improve privacy somewhat? For eg, toggle read and delivery receipts per-conversation/group, dismiss profile request banner in group conversation, etc. ?

Yes. Molly is open to contributions that addresses security issues or improve users privacy. However, every divergence versus Signal comes with a hidden maintenance cost to me, as I have to merge Signal code regularly and conflicts will arise. For example, changing the database schema is prohibitive.

As a first step, I’d suggest opening a feature-request issue on GitHub to discuss it in detail.

For bug fixes, it’s always better to contribute to Signal.
